author: ignaciohormigo
title: Latin America DeFi
description: Le pouvoir des grandes économies continue de bloquer le développement de l'Amérique latine

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has identified a problem within the challenge. Unfortunately the proposal lacks crucial information that could help the rate on its impact cardano. I suggest to the proposer to look at funded proposals and use them as reference to improve the structure of this proposal.The problem identified may fit into the challenge. However there is a serious need for improvements to  this project, for instance, by articulating how it adds value to the cardano ecosystem, adding key metrics and strong KPIs and all the other details that can be useful to the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: There is not enough information in this proposal to be feasible. The proposer should've added evidence of relevance skills and experiences, as well as the team and resources needed to complete the project. The proposer can extend the proposal improvement by adding a budget breakdown section, a timetable to complete the work, a clear description of what is being built and how.  Once all these areas are filled, I think that the proposal can have a chance of being approved in future funds.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks the basic information required to be auditable. The proposer should add a roadmap with realistic milestones , Metrics and KPIs and a clear description of the product being built and the problem it solves. The best way, in my opinion, to get help for structuring the proposal is to head over the funded proposal and emulate them.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seems to be a wish to develop a "Defi" to provide a " new investment alternative to those who today find themselves with an inaccessible financial market." This idea in itself is based on the assumption that " large economies continue to block the development of Latin America." Ther is a need to qualifying the assumption and a implementation plan for the proposal to be viable for processing.
f6_assessments.q1: It is good that Cardano is attracting young minds to think boldly and take initiative. The proposer is a "20 years old student of Economics". There is a need for more deliberation and homework required to make this idea an implementable plan.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal in the current state needs a plan and a team that can provide technical support and move the protocol ahead.  In the current state, it is difficult to audit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Accessing and improving the financial system in countries around the world in general and Latin America in particular is one of the important goals that Cardano is aiming for. We can understand that through the videos shared by Charles Hokinson.
But we need a specific solution and plan for that problem than an idea that the proposal offers here"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The proposer is 20 years old student of Economics. This experience can help the proposer to have good perspectives and ideas on issues related to finance and economics. To implement this proposal, the proposer needs more practical experience in the economic and blockchain field.
Specific plans and solutions are missing in this proposal to make it feasible"
f6_assessments.q2: There is no specific proposal presented or any audit critieria, so it is not possible for delivery to be audited. Importantly, there is no explanation of how the budget would be spent.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on establishing a new Latin American financial system by taking advantage of the transparency and reliability that Cardano offers. The idea is understandable, however, establishing a new Latin American financial system requires more in detail. Theoretically, I think this idea has a certain fit for the challenge and the Financial sector [especially in LATAM context]. In case this proposal needs to be completed in the future, the proposer should pay attention to: Defining sub-sector in finance that you focus on [because financial system is quite large]; and (2) Connecting with Haskell prgrammer(s) as your intention. Based on the given information, I can not agree with this proposal's impact and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: I am convinced by the idea description, and the proposer's relevant experience [20 years old student of Economics] and his context [Born in Patagonia and currently living and studying in Buenos Aires], which can prove some proof of feasibility for this idea. However, I am not convinced by an empty plan. So, I can see some proof of feasibility in the idea, not in the plan. Therefore, definitely, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is incomplete, auditability can not be guaranteed. Therefore, I don't have much advice, except that: the proposer needs to pay attention to the principle: judgment, information must be correctly associated with evidence and documents. As a result, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: Assessor was able to glean that the proposal aims to provide services primarily to the "bankless" or "unbanked".  However, proposer offers no concrete details on how and when the financial marketplace envisioned will offer greater decentralization and resilience on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: Assessor believes that money can be successfully used to hire programmers. However, there are no clear deliverables beyond that.
f6_assessments.q2: Assessor believes that money can be successfully used to hire programmers. However, there are no clear deliverables beyond that. Therefore, it will be difficult to audit the solutions hirees are developing for the community.
